data.meta_description: '1067–1204' published in 'A Chronology of the Byzantine Empire'
data.text:
Primary sources

Anna Comnena, Alexiad, transl. and ed. E.R. Sewter (London, 1969).

Geoffrey de Villehardouin, The Conquest of Constantinople (ed. Faral), 2 vols (Paris, 1938–9).

John Cinnamus, The Deeds of John II and Manuel I Comnenus, transl. Charles Brand (Columbia University Press, 1976).

Nicetas Choniates, History, translated by Harry Magoulias (Detroit, 1984).

Secondary sources

Charles Brand, Byzantium Confronts the West, 1180–1204 (Cambridge, Mas., 1968).

Ferdinand Chalandon, Les Comnene: Etudes sur l’empire byzantin au XI et au XII siecles, 2 vols (Paris, 1900/1912).

J. Chrysostomides (ed.), Essays Presented to Joan Hussey for her Eightieth Birthday: Bernard Hamilton, ‘Manuel I Comnenus and Baldwin IV of Jerusalem’, pp. 353–76.

G.W. Day, Genoa’s response to Byzantium, 1155–1204 (Urbana, 1978).

S. Fassoulakis, The Byzantine family of Raoul-Ral(l) es (Athens, 1973).

J.V.A. Fine, The Early Mediaeval Balkans: a Critical Survey from the Sixth to the Twelfth Century (Ann Arbor, 1983).

A. Kazhdan and A. Wharton Epstein, Change in Byzantine Culture in the Eleventh and Twelfth Centuries (University of California Press, 1985).

R. J. Lilie, Byzantium and the Crusader States, 1096–1204 (Oxford, 1993).

Paul Magdalino, The Empire of Manuel I Komnenos, 1143–1180 (Cambridge University Press, 1993).

Donald Nicol, Byzantium and Venice (Cambridge, 1988).

John Julius Norwich, The Normans in the South (London, 1967).

John Julius Norwich, The Kingdom in the Sun (London, 1970).

D. Polemis, The Doukai: A Contribution to Byzantine Prosography (London, 1968).

Steven Runciman, History of the Crusades: vol. 2, The Kingdom of Jerusalem (London, 1952).

Steven Runciman, The Eastern Schism (Oxford, 1955).

Spyros Vryonis, Byzantine Studes: Essays on the Slavic World and the Eleventh Century (New Rochelle, New York, 1992).

R.B. Yewdale, Bohemund I, Prince of Antioch (Princeton, 1924).

Articles

Byzantina, vol. 1 (1969): E. Tsolakis, ‘Michel Attaliates comme critique des Enterprises militaires’, p. 187.

Byzantina, vol. 8 (1976): E. Vranoussi, ‘A propos des operations des Normands dans la mer Agee et a Chypre après la prise de hessalonique (1185)’, pp. 203–11.

Byzantina Zeitschrift, vol. 58 (1965): D. Polemis, ‘Notes on Eleventh Century Chronology (1959–81)’, pp. 60–76.

Byzantion, vol. 7 (1932): J. Lamonte, ‘To what extent was Byzantium the suzerain to the Crusading states?’, pp. 253–64.

Byzantion, vol. 9 (1934): Claude Cahen, ‘La campagne de Mantzikert d’apres les sources musulmanes’, pp. 625–37.

Byzantion, vol. 18 (1948): Claude Cahen, ‘La premiere penetration Turque en Asie Mineure (seconde motie du Xi siecle), pp. 5–67.

Byzantion, vol. 20 (1950): P. Charanis, ‘Byzantium, the West, and the Origins of the First Crusade’, pp. 17–36.

Byzantion, vol. 26 (1956): G. Kolias, ‘Le motif et les raisons de l’invasion de Robert Guiscard en terre byzantine’, pp. 424–30.

Byzantion, vol. 31 (1961): Robert Browning, ‘The death of John II Comnenus’, pp. 229–35.

Byzantion, vol. 48 (1978): G. Day, ‘Byzantino-Genoese Diplomacy and the Collapse of Emperor Manuel I’s Western policy, 1168–71’, pp. 393–405.

Byzantion, vol. 50 (1980): J.C. Cheynet, ‘Mantzikert: un desastre militaire?’, pp. 410–38.

Byzantion, vol. 56 (1986): W.B. McQueen, ‘Relations between the Normans and Byzantium, 1071–1112’, pp. 427–76.

Byzantion, vol. 64 (1994): Michael and Elizabeth Jefferies, ‘Who was Irene the Sebastokratissa?’, pp. 40–68.

Papers of the British School at Rome, vol. 52 (1984): D. Abulafia, ‘Ancona, Byzantium and the Adriatic, 1155–73’, pp. 195–216.

Revue des Etudes Byzantines, vol.35 (1977): P. Gautier, ‘Defection et soumission de La Crete sous Alexis 1er’, pp. 215–27.

Speculum, vol. 58 (1993): Paul Magdalino, ‘Aspects of Twelfth-Century Byzantine Kaiserkritik’, pp. 326–46.

University of Birmingham Historical Journal, vol. 12 pt 2 (1970): A.A. Bryer, ‘A Byzantine Family: the Gabrades, c.979–1653’, pp. 164–87.

Crusades and crusader kingdoms: primary sources

The Chronicle of Fulcher of Chartres and Other Source Materials, ed. E. Peters, 2nd edition (University of Pennsylvania Press, 1998).

Gesta Francorum, ed. and trans. Rosalind Hill (London, 1962).

Fulcher of Chartres, Historia Hierosolymitana (1095–1127), edited G. Hagenmayer (Heidelberg, 1913).

Chronique de Michel le Syrien, 1166–1199, translated and edited by J. Chabot (Paris, 1902).

Walter the Chancellor’s ‘The Antiochene Wars’, transl. and commentary T. Ashbridge and S. Edington (Ashgate Publishing, 1999).
